subject: Re: [junit] Agitar Generates JUnit Tests
msgSnippet: ... I find the licensing scheme has one horrible side-effect: it appears to be based on the number of unique Java classes under agitation. Why would I spend
messageBody:
David Vydra wrote:
>
>
> Just noticed that Agitar released its JUnit generation. They have
> Flash demos on the site.

I find the licensing scheme has one horrible side-effect: it appears to
be based on the number of unique Java classes under agitation. Why would
I spend all that money on a tool that encourages me to write fewer,
probably bigger, classes?

I love Agitar's work in general, but I'm reacting very strongly to this
scheme.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
